alert.note: Alert for Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 25 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following county, Lubbock. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1256 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated a line of showers and thunderstorms producing heavy rain moving through Lubbock. Quick bursts of heavy rain was producing some minor urban and small stream flooding. Up to 0.6 inches of rain have fallen in western parts of Lubbock. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches will be possible over eastern parts of Lubbock County. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lubbock, Slaton, Abernathy, Wolfforth, Shallowater, Idalou, Ransom Canyon, Downtown Lubbock, Lubbock International Airport, Texas Tech University, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Woodrow, Reese Center, Slide, New Deal, Buffalo Springs and Lubbock Science Spectrum. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
